text: Norman Charles John Fleming (1903-1964) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. ==Playing career== Fleming came to St. George via the local Brighton junior club in 1929. He was a five-eighth and halfback in his playing days and turned out for the Saints on 65 occasions.THE SUN (Sydney) 8/9/1949 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/230937061?searchTerm=%22norm%20fleming%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=194, including 18 first grade games. Norm Fleming later coached his famous son, Doug Fleming in the lower grades at St. George in the late 1940s. Whiticker/Hudson, "The ENcyclopedia of Rugby League Players" 1995 Edition () Norm Fleming also served in the RAAF in World War II RAAF List WW2 http://www.ww2roll.gov.au/Veteran.aspx?serviceId=R&veteranId;=907788 . ==Death== Fleming died on 12 September 1964 at Jannali, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald- Death Notice 14/9/1964 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:1903 births Category:1964 deaths Category:Australian military personnel of World War II Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league halfbacks Category:Rugby league five-eighths
title: Norm Fleming
